newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh 1997/98 budget allocates fund for poor.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh 1997/98 budget allocates fund for poor.

text.p: Bangladesh Finance Minister S.A.M.S. Kibria on Thursday proposed a pension programme for elderly poor citizens.

Presenting the budget for 1997/98 fiscal year (July-June) in the parliament, Kibria said some 450,000 distressed elderly people would initially receive a monthly allowance from a 0.5 billion taka government fund. Each will get 100 taka a month.
"This is an insufficient measure in the backdrop of pervasive poverty. But it's an experiment and only a beginning," he said.
Kibria also proposed a 0.5 billion taka housing fund in 1997/98 to provide grants and loans for construction of low cost houses for the poor and homeless.
He said at least 3.1 million families in Bangladesh suffered from an acute housing problem.
